it.unibo.alchemist.model.interfaces

Interface IPosition

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<IPosition>, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Continuous2DEuclidean, ContinuousGenericEuclidean, Discrete2DManhattan, LatLongPosition

    public interface IPosition
extends Serializable, Comparable<IPosition>
    An interface to represent a generic coordinates system.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.apache.commons.math3.util.Pair<IPosition,IPosition> buildBoundingBox(double range)
      Given a range, produces two coordinates, representing two opposite vertices of the hypercube having the current coordinate as center and circumscribing the hypersphere defined by the range.

        compareTo

    • Method Detail

      • buildBoundingBox

        org.apache.commons.math3.util.Pair<IPosition,IPosition> buildBoundingBox(double range)
        Given a range, produces two coordinates, representing two opposite vertices of the hypercube having the current coordinate as center and circumscribing the hypersphere defined by the range. In the case of two dimensional coordinates, it must return the opposite vertices of the square circumscribing the circle with center in this position and radius range.
        Parameters:
        range - the radius of the hypersphere
        Returns:
        the vertices of the circumscribed hypercube

      • getCartesianCoordinates

        double[] getCartesianCoordinates()
        Allows to get the position as a Number array.
        Returns:
        an array of size getDimensions() where each element represents a coordinate.

      • getCoordinate

        double getCoordinate(int dim)
        Allows to access the value of a coordinate.
        Parameters:
        dim - the dimension. E.g., in a 2-dimensional implementation, 0 could be the X-axis and 1 the Y-axis
        Returns:
        the coordinate value

      • getDimensions

        int getDimensions()
        Returns:
        the number of dimensions of this IPosition.

      • getDistanceTo

        double getDistanceTo(IPosition p)
        Computes the distance between this position and another compatible position.
        Parameters:
        p - the position you want to know the distance from this position
        Returns:
        the distance between this and p
